title: Citi Establishes Direct Custody and Clearing Services in Panama
summary: New York – Citi announced today that its Global Transaction Services business began providing Direct Custody and Clearing (DCC) services to clients investing in Panama. This new service expands Citi's proprietary DCC network to eight markets across Latin America.
tag-1: Citi Establishes Direct Custody and Clearing Services in Panama
tag-3: New York – Citi announced today that its Global Transaction Services business began providing Direct Custody and Clearing (DCC) services to clients investing in Panama. This new service expands Citi's proprietary DCC network to eight markets across Latin America.
tag-4: Through its sub-custody services, Citi opens the door of the Panamanian capital markets to international investors.
tag-5: "We are delighted to offer Direct Custody and Clearing services in Panama, which is the leading economy in Central America," says Lee Waite, Global Head of Direct Custody and Clearing. "This opening marks a major milestone in Citi's proprietary DCC network and demonstrates our long-standing commitment to support our clients in accessing the growing capital markets in Panama, Latin America and around the world."
tag-6: The new DCC services in Panama are being supported by Citi's Regional Service Center in Tampa, Fla., to achieve consistent processing, standardized reporting, uniform technology and have the ability of resource reallocation to accommodate changes in capacity and volume.
tag-7: DCC plays an integral role in capital markets by providing the clearing and settlement services for broker dealers and global custodians to support trading and investment activities around the world.
tag-8: Through its Securities and Fund Services business, Citi's industry-focused experts provide institutional investors worldwide with tailored solutions delivered through proven global platforms that feature modular, open architecture. Global Transaction Services, a division of Citi's Institutional Clients Group, offers integrated cash management, trade, and securities and fund services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations around the world.
tag-9: Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
